intro: Disporopsis undulata, commonly known as the wavy disporopsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are elliptical and have a slightly wavy margin, giving it its common name. Disporopsis undulata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth.
